author: Jessica Hiott
original_review: I really love so many of the features of this app.  I love the customization, the smoothness, the speed, the clarity.  What I really don't like is that I can get messages just fine then all of a sudden, nothing.  Then I have to reset my phone (sometimes twice) & then I'm bombarded by numerous messages that I missed throughout the day.  I want to use this as my regular app but if it doesn't function properly I just can't.

author: Ben Bouissieres
original_review: Textra fixes all the issues that stock text apps have: slow down and undelivered texts. The only issue is that the audio file player is terrible. If you move your phone, send a text, deliver a text, receive a text, or scroll down too far, the audio stops. And you CAN'T RESUME or play the audio from the middle, it always starts from the beginning, and if you get interrupted at all, youll have to play it from the beginning again. Also it's difficult to send audio files that you've recorded outside of textra.

And you CAN'T RESUME or play the audio from the middle, it always starts from the beginning, and if you get interrupted at all, youll have to play it from the beginning again. Also it's difficult to send audio files that you've recorded outside of textra.

author: Brad Caviness
original_review: Tried out Textra after T-Mobile's android OTA went out. For both my Note 4 and note 5, they keyboard in the messaging app lagged horribly, so I decided I'd give it a shot. I'm glad I did. No lag issues, and even when the ads started, it only shows as your top messaging conversation and doesn't pop up and get in the way. My favorite part is that I can make it a dark-themed background with white text which is perfect for night time texting and is easier on your eyes. I'll be sticking with Textra. No doubt.

author: Charles Ferguson
original_review: At the risk of sounding grandiose, I'm going to propose that this app contains some of the best UI of the last 20 years, and that it solves a pervasive problem that everyone else has given up on or ignored.   You can delete a text without it asking you if you really want to.   Highlight the message and tap the trash can twice and you're done. It's gone. This solution could be applied to every peace of software there is. This is the fix, and I've never seen it anywhere before. Infinite kudos for some of the best work I've seen in a very long time!

Or maybe I'm just texting wrong and it's not a necessary function, lol. Anyway, thanks for the great app!

author: Joshua Booth
original_review: If you want an ad-free version like the one shown in the screenshots, you have to buy the pro version through an in-app purchase. There is no mention of this in the description, and the app will not have any ads for several weeks - and then suddenly flash up a notification saying your "free trial" has expired and you now need to purchase it. The only reason I can see for them to not mention that their app actually costs money/adspam is so people can give Textra good reviews thinking it's $0 and ad-free.

author: Jarred Powell
original_review: I just moved from iPhone to Android and brought 60,000 messages across with me. That represented every message I'd ever sent to my wife, and I really didn't want to lose them. The default messaging app couldn't even open! But Textra imported every one and has since run flawlessly without a hiccup. The visual customisation is fantastic, and the search function is nice too. I've since gotten one of my friends to convert to Textra, and if you do the same, I promise you won't regret it. Fantastic app.

author: Keith Marshall
original_review: I've been using it for over a year and can't imagine using anything else. I was happy to pay $1 to help fund their work. They've been great to respond to feedback too! Last week I upgraded my Nexus 5 to android 6 (Marshmallow) and noticed that the notification sound from Textra was getting cutoff abruptly so I sent them feedback about it. Later that evening I received a reply saying they'd look into it. Within 24 hours they sent me a link to download an updated version that fixed the problem!

author: Ryan Mitchell
original_review: Having used this SMS app for going on two years now, I feel I can give an accurate and decent review of it. Textra is a clean, simple, user friendly SMS application that simply kills the built in messaging applications on any phone I've used. Currently I'm running it on a Samsung GS5 and its by far and away, hands down, better AND more effective than the Samsung or Verizon built in messaging crApp.  Its easy to customize and its simple. Simple is what I want. I don't need an SMS app to access every aspect of my social life. I don't want it to ask me for my G+/FB account info every other time I log in.Textra does its job with little or no setup time BUT! if you want to customize it, then it has easy to use options/add-ons. Yes, it used to be free/ad-free - now its not. But with the amount of attention the coding team puts into this application, a couple of bucks is worth it to me. Keep in mind this was one of the first SMS applications that locked down and prevented the 'Stagefright' exploit. Literally 24 hours after the exploit was publicly announced, Textra had a patch. I'm STILL waiting on samsung/google/verizon to release an update for my device that will eliminate that exploit.

author: Lisa Veras
original_review: I love this app. It's definitely the cleanest, simplest looking texting app I've seen. Everything runs very smoothly and I love the ability to open a notification and write a quick reply on a window on top of what I'm already doing. The free version is a trial and after a certain time you will get ads but the ads are infrequent and unobtrusive (no videos or anything of that). I will be paying for the full version soon just because I want to support this app.

author: Jon Daugherty
original_review: Recently, textra has become a major storage hog. My textra app uses 2.2gb on my phone. There needs to be a way to limit the amount of storage or delete old messages after a certain time. Currently the only way to do this is manually. A manual deletion of hundreds of thousands of messages is a complete waste of time when automation of this functionality is available on many other apps, and even on the stock installed messaging app. We should be able to limit messages by age (delete old messages after a time)

With the emotion out of the picture, 4 stars is far more accurate, so I edited the rating. Not perfect, but a very good app overall.
